text: Gary Baker (born August 8, 1952, in Niagara Falls, New Yorkhttp://www.alamhof.org/garybaker.html Gary Baker Bio) is an American country music singer and songwriter. ==Career== In the late 1970s, Baker was a musician with the LeBlanc and Carr Band. Baker was also a singer musician with the country-pop band, The Shooters. He has written songs for John Michael Montgomery, Alabama and others. Baker has been writing with his songwriting partner, Frank J. Myers since 1988, both having played in Marie Osmond's band. Baker and Myers' most successful song as songwriters is "I Swear", recorded by both All 4-One and John Michael Montgomery. The song sold more than 20 million copies internationally,"Gary Baker has Midas Touch" and won the 1995 Grammy for "Best Country Song"."Grammy Awards: Best Country Song" In 1995, he and Myers recorded one album on Curb Records as the duo Baker & Myers. He also wrote the hit "I'm Already There" for Lonestar.It spent six weeks at the top of the Billboard Hot Country Singles & Tracks chart. The song was the band's seventh Number One. ==Personal life== Baker lives in Sheffield, Alabama with his wife and his two sons, Brett and Cole and daughter Ashley. ==See also== *Baker & Myers ==References== ==External links== * *Gary Baker Interview NAMM Oral History Library (2017) Category:American country singer-songwriters Category:Record producers from New York (state) Category:Living people Category:Musicians from Niagara Falls, New York Category:1952 births Category:Songs written by Gary Baker (songwriter) Category:Songwriters from New York (state) Category:Country musicians from New York (state)
